b_data: The peak of Monsoon season comes to an end with the beginning of September. June had ended with above normal rains to the tune of 16%. But, July consumed all the surplus rainfall left over by June and registered 17% less rains than the long period average (LPA).

b_head: Forecast for Monsoon 2015 in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Odisha
b_data: Southwest Monsoon entered Madhya Pradesh by June 14, a little behind schedule. It covered the entire country by June 25. The sea surface temperature of the Bay of Bengal was quite low in the initial days of the onset of Southwest Monsoon.

b_head: Dry spell of weather to end in Madhya Pradesh
b_data: The well-marked low pressure area that originated over westcentral Bay of Bengal off Odisha coast and moved in a westerly direction is now lying over Jharkhand and North Chhattisgarh. The weather system is likely to move further northwest.

b_head: Rain likely in parts of Southeast Rajasthan
b_data: Monsoon usually reaches Rajasthan after June 15. However, the region did witness decent pre-Monsoon showers before the arrival of Monsoon. By the end of June itself, West Rajasthan observed a rainfall surplus of 78 per cent, while East Rajasthan was excess by 84 per cent.

b_head: Monsoon India 2015: Southwest Monsoon Forecast For August 30
b_data: A low pressure area currently exists over East Bihar and adjoining Jharkhand. Also, a feeble Western Disturbance resides over Jammu and Kashmir and is moving in the northeast direction. The western arm of the Monsoon trough is running close to the foothills and is passing through Bareilly and Gorakhpur extending up to the northeast region.

b_head: Monsoon 2015: Latest update on Southwest Monsoon in India
b_data: Most parts of Northeast India and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal along with Sikkim have been experiencing vigorous Monsoon conditions. In a span of 24 hours from 8:30 am on Saturday, Dibrugarh received a whopping 195 mm of rainfall. Very heavy Monsoon showers were also observed over Pasighat (187 mm) in Arunachal Pradesh.

b_head: Southwest Monsoon: East and Northeast India witness good Monsoon showers
b_data: The low pressure area over East India has given good rainfall over Odisha and Andhra Pradesh. The system is likely to shift westwards and will now be giving moderate to heavy rain over parts of Chhattisgarh, East Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra. Also under the influence of this system, Bihar, Jharkhand and West Bengal will get good Monsoon showers.

b_head: Good rains to continue in Bangladesh
b_data: Bangladesh is getting fairly widespread light to moderate rain/thundershowers since the past 24 hours. A low pressure area is over Odisha and its adjoining areas. Therefore winds over Bangladesh are southerly with moderate speed.

b_head: Latest update on weather for Pakistan
b_data: Since the past few days many areas in Pakistan have been receiving good amounts of rain. These rains were attributed to a Western Disturbance which was over North Pakistan. This had also resulted in a drop in the temperatures in some areas of the country.

Due to a low pressure area lying over coastal parts of Odisha the state continues to receive light to moderate rain. Heavy rain at isolated places with widespread light rain will continue in Odisha after which the rainfall activity move westwards towards Madhya Pradesh and Vidarbha.
